source.name: City of Dallas Sanitation Services
source.notes: Based on official City of Dallas Sanitation Services recycling guidelines. Blue bin recycling collected weekly. Pizza boxes accepted (remove excess cheese).

materials.name: Plastic bottles
instructions: Empty and rinse
Replace cap
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Dallas accepts #1-#5 and #7 plastics
Quick rinse is sufficient; no need to scrub
commonMistakes: Don't include bottles with liquid still in them
Don't crush bottles (caps can come off)

materials.name: Plastic containers
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: #1-#5 and #7 rigid plastics accepted in Dallas
Quick rinse sufficient
commonMistakes: No styrofoam containers
No black plastic takeout containers

materials.name: Plastic jugs
instructions: Empty and rinse
Replace cap
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Large HDPE jugs are highly recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't include jugs with liquid in them

materials.name: Aluminum cans
instructions: Empty and rinse
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Aluminum is infinitely recyclable
Dallas collects blue bins weekly
commonMistakes: Don't crush cans (makes sorting harder)
Don't include cans with food residue

materials.name: Steel / tin cans
instructions: Empty and rinse
Labels can stay on
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: A magnet sticks to steel cans but not aluminum
commonMistakes: Don't include cans with food still in them

materials.name: Glass bottles and jars
instructions: Empty and rinse
Remove metal lids (recycle lids separately)
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Dallas accepts glass bottles and jars in curbside recycling
All colors of glass accepted
commonMistakes: Don't include broken glass; wrap and trash it
Don't include ceramics, mirrors, or window glass

materials.name: Cardboard
instructions: Flatten all boxes
Remove packing materials (styrofoam, bubble wrap)
Place in or beside blue recycling bin
notes: Break down boxes to save space in the bin
commonMistakes: Don't include cardboard soaked with grease or food
Remove tape if easily peeled; small amounts OK

materials.name: Boxboard / paperboard
instructions: Flatten
Remove plastic liner bags (trash them)
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Thin paperboard/boxboard is accepted in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't include the plastic liner inside cereal boxes
Don't include wax-coated boxes

materials.name: Pizza box
instructions: Remove excess cheese and food debris
Place in blue recycling bin
Light grease stains are OK
notes: Dallas specifically accepts pizza boxes; just remove excess cheese
This is different from many cities that reject pizza boxes
commonMistakes: Don't leave large amounts of food or cheese in the box
A few grease spots are fine; don't overthink it

materials.name: Mixed paper
instructions: Place in blue recycling bin
No need to remove staples or paper clips
No need to sort by type
notes: Dallas accepts all clean, dry paper
Includes newspapers, magazines, junk mail, and office paper
commonMistakes: Don't include paper towels or tissues
Don't bag paper in plastic bags
Don't include shredded paper

materials.name: Milk / juice cartons
instructions: Empty and rinse
Replace cap if it has one
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Both shelf-stable (aseptic) and refrigerated cartons accepted
commonMistakes: Don't flatten cartons

materials.name: Aerosol cans
instructions: Must be completely empty
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Non-empty aerosols are hazardous waste
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized or has product left
Don't puncture

materials.name: Aluminum foil
instructions: Clean off all food residue
Ball up into a ball at least 2 inches across
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Must be clean to be recyclable
commonMistakes: Don't recycle heavily soiled foil; trash it
Small pieces fall through sorting screens; ball them up

materials.name: Plastic bags
instructions: Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
Take to retailer drop-off bins at Kroger, Walmart, or Target
Otherwise place in trash
notes: Plastic bags jam Dallas recycling machinery
Most grocery stores in Dallas have bag recycling bins near the entrance
commonMistakes: Never bag recyclables in plastic bags
Don't put any film plastic in the blue bin

materials.name: Styrofoam
instructions: Place in trash
Not accepted in Dallas curbside recycling
notes: No curbside or drop-off recycling for styrofoam in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't confuse rigid plastic containers with styrofoam

materials.name: Plastic utensils
instructions: Place in trash
Not recyclable in Dallas
notes: Too small and lightweight for recycling sorting equipment
Reusable utensils are the best alternative
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't assume compostable utensils can go in recycling

materials.name: Shredded paper
instructions: Place in trash
Not accepted in Dallas curbside recycling
Too small to sort at recycling facility
notes: Shredded paper jams recycling equipment
Consider composting at home if possible
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't put loose shredded paper in recycling even in a paper bag

materials.name: Clothing and textiles
instructions: Donate to Goodwill, Salvation Army, or local thrift stores
Textile recycling bins at various Dallas locations
Do NOT put in blue recycling bin or trash
notes: Even torn or stained clothing can be recycled as textile fiber
Dallas has multiple Goodwill and Salvation Army locations
commonMistakes: Don't put clothing in curbside recycling
Don't throw usable clothing in trash

materials.name: Wires and cables
instructions: Take to Best Buy or Community Recycling Drop-Off
Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
Cables tangle in recycling machinery
notes: Best Buy accepts up to 3 items per household per day for free
Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off locations also accept
commonMistakes: Never put cables in curbside recycling
Tangled cables shut down sorting equipment

materials.name: Metal hangers
instructions: Place in trash
Or return to dry cleaners for reuse
Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
notes: Wire hangers tangle in recycling equipment
Many dry cleaners in Dallas will take them back
commonMistakes: Never put hangers in curbside recycling
They jam sorting machinery

materials.name: Food waste
instructions: Place in trash (gray/green garbage cart)
Dallas does not have curbside composting
Consider home composting as an alternative
notes: Dallas does not offer a municipal composting program
Some private composting services operate in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put food waste in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Yard waste
instructions: Place in trash cart for regular small amounts
For large brush: schedule Brush and Bulky Item Collection by calling 311
Cut branches to 6 feet or shorter, bundle, and tie
notes: Dallas offers Brush and Bulky Item Collection by appointment
Call 311 or visit dallascityhall.com to schedule
commonMistakes: Don't pile brush at curb without scheduling pickup
Don't put yard waste in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Batteries
instructions: Do not put in trash or recycling
Take to a Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off location
Tape terminals of lithium and 9V batteries before transport
notes: Batteries can cause fires in garbage trucks and at recycling facilities
Dallas has multiple Community Recycling Drop-Off locations
commonMistakes: Don't throw batteries in trash
Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Electronics / E-waste
instructions: Take to a Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off location
Best Buy accepts many electronics for free recycling
Delete personal data before disposal
notes: Texas law prohibits putting certain e-waste in the trash
Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off locations accept electronics at no charge
commonMistakes: Don't put electronics in trash or recycling
Don't forget to wipe personal data

materials.name: Paint
instructions: Take to Dallas Home Chemical Collection Center
Latex paint: can dry out with kitty litter and trash if less than 1 inch remains
Oil-based paint: must go to hazardous waste drop-off
notes: Dallas holds periodic Home Chemical Collection events
Check dallascityhall.com for event schedules
commonMistakes: Don't pour paint down drains
Don't put liquid paint in trash

materials.name: Motor oil
instructions: Take to a Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off location
AutoZone and O'Reilly in Dallas also accept used oil for free
notes: Most auto parts stores accept used oil at no charge
commonMistakes: Don't pour down drains or on the ground
Don't mix with other fluids

materials.name: Medications
instructions: Take to a DEA-authorized drug take-back location
Dallas PD stations have permanent take-back boxes
If no drop-off available: mix with coffee grounds, seal in bag, and trash
notes: DEA National Prescription Drug Take Back Days occur twice yearly
Many Walgreens and CVS in Dallas participate in take-back programs
commonMistakes: Don't flush medications
Don't throw loose pills in trash

materials.name: Light bulbs
instructions: CFL and fluorescent: take to Community Recycling Drop-Off or Home Depot/Lowe's
LED bulbs: take to e-waste recycling
Incandescent: wrap and place in trash
notes: CFL and fluorescent bulbs contain mercury
Home Depot and Lowe's accept CFL bulbs for free
commonMistakes: Don't put CFL bulbs in trash; mercury is hazardous
Don't put any bulbs in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Cooking oil / grease
instructions: Collect in a sealed container
Take to a Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off location
Never pour down drains or into storm drains
notes: Pouring grease down the drain causes sewer blockages
commonMistakes: Don't pour down sink
Don't pour into yard or storm drains

materials.name: Propane tanks
instructions: Take to Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off location
Never put in trash or recycling
Home improvement stores may accept for exchange
notes: Pressurized containers are fire and explosion risks in garbage trucks
commonMistakes: Never puncture
Never put in trash

materials.name: Needles / sharps
instructions: Place in FDA-cleared sharps container or heavy-duty plastic bottle
Seal and label container 'SHARPS'
Take to Community Recycling Drop-Off or hazardous waste event
notes: Never place loose sharps in trash or recycling
commonMistakes: Never put loose needles in trash
Never put in recycling

materials.name: Smartphone / phone
instructions: Factory reset and remove personal data
Trade in at carrier stores, Apple, or Samsung
Take to Best Buy or Community Recycling Drop-Off for free recycling
notes: Working phones can be donated to charity
Many carriers offer trade-in credit
commonMistakes: Don't forget to wipe personal data
Don't put in trash; phones contain hazardous materials

materials.name: Candy wrapper
instructions: Place in trash
Metallized plastic film is not recyclable
notes: Candy wrappers look metallic but are not aluminum; they're plastic film with a metallic coating
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling
Don't put in compost

materials.name: Chip bag
instructions: Place in trash
Metallized plastic is not recyclable in Dallas
notes: The shiny interior is aluminum bonded to plastic; cannot be separated
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Disposable coffee cups
instructions: Lined paper cups go in trash
Plastic lids: place in blue recycling bin
Paper sleeve: place in blue recycling bin
notes: The plastic/wax lining prevents paper cup recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put lined cups in recycling
Separate the lid and sleeve for recycling

materials.name: Diapers
instructions: Bag and place in trash
notes: Not recyclable or compostable
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling
Don't put in yard waste

materials.name: Receipts
instructions: Place in trash
Thermal paper contains BPA; do not recycle
notes: Thermal receipts contaminate paper recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't compost

materials.name: Bubble wrap / packing materials
instructions: Place in trash
Or take plastic film to store drop-off bins
Do NOT put in blue recycling bin
notes: Plastic film jams recycling machinery
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Pet waste
instructions: Bag and place in trash
notes: Pet waste contains harmful bacteria; never compost
commonMistakes: Never compost pet waste
Don't flush cat litter

materials.name: Fast food wrapper
instructions: Food-soiled wrappers go in trash
Clean paper wrappers can go in blue recycling bin
notes: Dallas has no curbside composting for food-soiled paper
commonMistakes: Don't put greasy wrappers in the blue recycling bin

materials.name: Books
instructions: Donate if in good condition: Half Price Books, Goodwill, Dallas Public Library
If damaged, recycle paper pages in blue bin
Remove hardcover bindings with glossy laminate (trash them)
notes: Half Price Books has multiple Dallas locations and buys used books
Donating is always better than recycling
commonMistakes: Don't throw usable books in trash

materials.name: Toothbrush
instructions: Place in trash
notes: Mixed plastic; not recyclable in curbside programs
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Makeup / cosmetics
instructions: Most cosmetic containers go in trash
Clean empty #1/#2/#5 containers may be recyclable
notes: Check brand take-back programs (MAC, Kiehl's, etc.)
commonMistakes: Small items fall through sorting screens at recycling facilities

materials.name: Mirrors
instructions: Wrap carefully in newspaper or cardboard
Place in trash
Label as BROKEN GLASS if broken
notes: Metallic coating prevents glass recycling
commonMistakes: Never put in blue recycling bin
Not the same as glass bottles

materials.name: Ceramics / pottery
instructions: Place in trash
Wrap carefully if broken
notes: Ceramics contaminate glass recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't mix with glass bottles

materials.name: Mattress
instructions: Schedule Brush and Bulky Item Collection by calling Dallas 311
Or take to a Dallas landfill/transfer station
notes: Dallas offers Brush and Bulky Item Collection by appointment
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling pickup

materials.name: Large / bulk items
instructions: Schedule Brush and Bulky Item Collection by calling Dallas 311 or online
Place at curb on scheduled day
notes: Brush and Bulky Item Collection handles large items by appointment
Check dallascityhall.com for scheduling
commonMistakes: Don't leave at curb without scheduling
Don't put in the alley without an appointment

materials.name: Tires
instructions: Take to a tire retailer (most accept old tires when you buy new)
Or take to Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off
Do NOT place at curb
notes: Illegal to dump tires; fines apply in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put with Brush and Bulky collection
Don't dump illegally

materials.name: Ink / toner cartridges
instructions: Return to Staples or Office Depot
Manufacturers offer mail-back programs
Best Buy also accepts printer cartridges
notes: Some stores give credit for cartridge returns
commonMistakes: Don't throw in trash
Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Fluorescent tubes
instructions: Take to a Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off location
Home Depot and Lowe's also accept them for free
notes: Contains mercury; handle carefully and don't break
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash
Don't break them; mercury is released

materials.name: Cleaning product bottles
instructions: Empty completely
Quick rinse
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Most cleaning product bottles are #1 or #2 plastic
commonMistakes: Make sure completely empty before recycling

materials.name: Wax paper / parchment paper
instructions: Place in trash
Not recyclable due to wax/silicone coating
Dallas has no curbside composting
notes: Wax and silicone coatings prevent recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Fruit / fruit scraps
instructions: Place in trash
Dallas does not offer curbside composting
Consider home composting
notes: No municipal composting in Dallas; food waste goes to trash
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Vegetables / vegetable scraps
instructions: Place in trash
Dallas does not offer curbside composting
notes: Consider home composting for garden benefits
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Meat and bones
instructions: Place in trash
Bag securely to prevent odors and pests
notes: No curbside composting in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Dairy products
instructions: Pour expired liquid dairy down drain
Solid dairy waste goes in trash
Rinse and recycle the container separately
notes: No municipal composting for dairy in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't pour dairy down storm drains
Recycle the container after rinsing

materials.name: Bread and grains
instructions: Place in trash
Consider home composting
notes: No curbside composting in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Coffee grounds / tea bags
instructions: Place in trash
Or home compost if you have a bin
notes: Coffee grounds are excellent for home composting
No municipal composting in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Eggs / eggshells
instructions: Place in trash
Or home compost if you have a bin
notes: Eggshells are great for home composting
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Paper towels / napkins
instructions: Place in trash
Not recyclable due to contamination and fiber breakdown
notes: Too short-fiber and contaminated for recycling
Consider composting at home
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Wax-coated food liners
instructions: Place in trash
Wax coating prevents recycling
notes: No curbside composting option in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Garden hose
instructions: Cut into short lengths and place in trash
Or schedule Brush and Bulky for large amounts
notes: Hoses tangle in recycling machinery like cables
commonMistakes: Never put in curbside recycling

materials.name: Car battery
instructions: Take to AutoZone, O'Reilly, or any auto parts store
Most stores accept free and may give core credit
Or take to Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off
notes: Lead-acid batteries are nearly 100% recyclable
Texas law requires retailers to accept old batteries
commonMistakes: Never put in trash; contains lead and acid
Don't put in blue recycling bin

materials.name: Smoke detectors
instructions: Ionization type: mail back to manufacturer (contains radioactive material)
Photoelectric type: take to e-waste recycling
Check the back of the unit for type
notes: Ionization smoke detectors contain small amounts of Americium-241
commonMistakes: Don't put in trash or recycling

materials.name: Plastic toys
instructions: Donate if in working condition
If broken or not donatable, place in trash
Not accepted in Dallas curbside recycling
notes: Mixed plastics and small parts make toys non-recyclable
Goodwill and Salvation Army accept working toys
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Donate before trashing

materials.name: Empty spray paint cans
instructions: Must be completely empty (no liquid or pressure)
Place in blue recycling bin
If not fully empty, treat as hazardous waste
notes: Completely empty aerosol cans are recyclable as metal
If it still sprays, it's hazardous waste
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if still pressurized
Don't puncture to empty

materials.name: Junk mail / catalogs
instructions: Place directly in blue recycling bin
No need to remove plastic windows from envelopes
No need to remove staples
notes: All paper mail is recyclable in Dallas
commonMistakes: Don't shred it (shredded paper is not accepted)
Don't bag it in plastic

materials.name: Aluminum baking pans
instructions: Clean off all food residue
Place in blue recycling bin
notes: Must be clean; heavily soiled ones go in trash
commonMistakes: Don't recycle if caked with baked-on food

materials.name: Snack pouches
instructions: Place in trash
Multi-layer flexible packaging is not recyclable
notes: Made of multiple bonded layers that can't be separated
commonMistakes: Don't put in recycling

materials.name: Window glass / plate glass
instructions: Wrap carefully in newspaper or cardboard
Place in trash
Label 'BROKEN GLASS' if broken
notes: Window glass has different melting point than bottle glass; contaminates recycling
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Not the same as glass bottles and jars

materials.name: Plastic wrap / cling film
instructions: Place in trash
Not recyclable in Dallas curbside program
notes: Too thin and clingy for recycling sorting equipment
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't confuse with rigid plastic containers

materials.name: Small appliances
instructions: Donate if working: Goodwill, Salvation Army
If broken: take to Community Recycling Drop-Off
Or schedule Brush and Bulky Item Collection
notes: Many small appliances are accepted at Community Recycling Drop-Off
commonMistakes: Don't put in blue recycling bin
Don't put in trash if it can be donated or recycled

trash: Plastic bags and film (or take to retailer drop-off)

tips: Quick rinse is sufficient; no need to scrub containers clean
Pizza boxes are OK; just remove excess cheese and food debris
Flatten all cardboard and boxboard boxes
No plastic bags: don't bag your recyclables
Take plastic bags to Kroger, Walmart, or Target for store drop-off recycling
No curbside composting in Dallas; food waste goes in trash
Schedule Brush and Bulky Item Collection through Dallas 311 for large items
Use Community Recycling Drop-Off locations for batteries, electronics, paint, and other special items

locations.name: Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off (Northwest)
locations.notes: Free for Dallas residents with proof of residency.

locations.name: Dallas Community Recycling Drop-Off (Southeast)
locations.notes: Free for Dallas residents with proof of residency.

locations.name: Dallas Home Chemical Collection Center
locations.hours: First Saturday of each month, plus periodic events
locations.notes: Check website for current schedule. Free for Dallas residents.
